birds-eye-camera

A flexible birds eye camera for WebGL.

Installing

npm install birds-eye-camera

Usage

const shell = require('gl-now')()
const createCamera = require('./birds-eye-camera.js')

let camera
let geometry
let shader

shell.on("gl-init", function() {
    shell.gl.enable(shell.gl.DEPTH_TEST)

    shader = /* Some basic shader */
    geometry = /* Some sample geometry. */
    geometry.bind(shader)

    camera = createCamera({
        up: [ 0, 1, 0 ],
        alignment: [ 0.707, 0, 0.707 ],
        target: [ 0, 0, 0 ],
        rotationX: - Math.PI / 4,
        distance: 10,
        speed: 20
    })
})

let projection = /* projection matrix */
let view       = mat4.create()
let model      = mat4.create()

shell.on("gl-render", function() {
    view = camera.view() // Get current view matrix, which transforms world space into camera space.

    /* Update projection, view and model matrix uniforms here. */

    geometry.draw(shell.gl.TRIANGLES)
})

API

camera = createCamera([ options ])

options has the following defaults:

{
    up:        [ 0, 1, 0 ] // normal to the plane
    alignment: [ 0, 0, 1 ] // should be orthogonal to up and normalized
    distance:  10
    rotationX: - Math.PI / 4 // angle with which the bird looks down
    target:    [ 0, 0, 0 ] // point the camera looks at
    speed:     5 // movement speed
}
